Class TEIFormater

    Patrice Lopez

      • toTEIBodyLight

        public StringBuilder toTEIBodyLight(StringBuilder buffer,
                           String result,
                           BiblioItem biblio,
                           List<BibDataSet> bds,
                           LayoutTokenization layoutTokenization,
                           Document doc,
                           boolean generateIDs,
                           boolean generateImageReferences,
                           boolean generateCoordinates)
                             throws Exception
        Light TEI formatting of the body where only basic logical document structures are present. This TEI format avoids most of the risks of ill-formed TEI due to structure recognition errors and frequent PDF noises. It is adapted to fully automatic process and simple exploitation of the document structures like structured indexing and search.
        Throws:
        Exception

                               boolean generateCoordinates)
                                 throws Exception

      • toTEIBodyML

        public StringBuilder toTEIBodyML(StringBuilder tei,
                        String rese,
                        BiblioItem biblio,
                        List<BibDataSet> bds,
                        List<String> tokenizations,
                        Document doc)
                          throws Exception
        TEI formatting of the body where we try to realize the full logical document structure. At this stage of development, the TEI might be ill-formed due to the complexity of the task and PDF noises, and thus can require additional human editing efforts. This formatting is adapted to more complex further scenario such as document multi-publishing and archiving.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • toTEIAnnexML

                         Document doc)
                           throws Exception
        Throws:

      • bracketReferenceSegment

        public static String bracketReferenceSegment(String text)
        Identify in a reference string the part in bracket. Return null if no opening and closing bracket can be found.
